Key Match Events: Ireland struggled to build momentum and slumped to 59-6
George Dockrell and Mark Adair battled their side back into contention with a 62-run stand for the seventh-wicket
Requiring 17 from the last over, Ireland were unable to reach their target
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland captain Paul Stirling would have been delighted to call right at the toss
Ireland needed to win both of their final two matches in Group A to stand any chance of progressing to the knockout stages
Post-Match Reflections: Ireland now head to Florida, where they play their final two fixtures in Group A against co-hosts USA on Friday, 14 June and Pakistan two days later
Miscellaneous Highlights: The opening match was dominated by the ball
Having lost to World No.1 India at the same venue two days earlier
Others: Ireland Men’s hopes of reaching the 2024 ICC Men’s T20 World Cup Super 8s hang in the balance after a 12-run loss to Canada in New York on Friday
